stage.name: Stage1
stage.code:
Private CurrentInstance As Object
' Map of instances keyed against the handles which represent them. ' Private HandleMap As Dictionary(Of Integer, Object)
' Map of handles keyed against the instances they represent. ' Here to ensure we don't assign multiple handles to a single ' instance and bring about a memory leak ' Private InstanceMap As Dictionary(Of Object, Integer)
' Constructor - this just initialises the collections which map ' the word instances to handles and vice versa. Public Sub New()
Me.HandleMap = New Dictionary(Of Integer, Object)() Me.InstanceMap = New Dictionary(Of Object, Integer)()
End Sub
Protected Function GetInstance(Handle As Integer) As Object
Dim Instance As Object = Nothing
If Handle = 0 Then If CurrentInstance Is Nothing Then ' Special case - getting the current instance when the ' instance is not set, try and get a current open instance. ' If none there, create a new one and assign a handle as if ' CreateInstance() had been called ' Try ' Instance = GetObject(,"PowerPoint.Application") ' Catch ex as Exception ' Not running ' Instance = Nothing ' End Try ' If Instance Is Nothing Then Create_Instance(Handle) ' Instance = CreateObject("PowerPoint.Application") ' Force the instance into the maps. ' GetHandle(Instance) ' CurrentInstance should now be set. ' If it's not, we have far bigger problems ' End If End If Return CurrentInstance End If
Instance = HandleMap(Handle) If Not Instance Is Nothing Then CurrentInstance = Instance End If Return Instance
End Function
Protected Function GetHandle(Instance As Object) As Integer
If Instance Is Nothing Then Throw New ArgumentNullException("Tried to add an empty instance") End If
' Check if we already have this instance - if so, return it. If InstanceMap.ContainsKey(Instance) Then CurrentInstance = Instance Return InstanceMap(Instance) End If
Dim key as Integer For key = 1 to Integer.MaxValue If Not HandleMap.ContainsKey(key) HandleMap.Add(key, Instance) InstanceMap.Add(Instance, key) Me.CurrentInstance = Instance Return key End If Next key
Return 0
End Function
' Gets the document in the given instance with the given name. ' ' @param Handle The handle representing the instance which holds the document ' ' @param Name The name of the document on the instance ' ' @return The object representing the document defined Protected Function GetDocument(Handle As Integer, Name as String) As Object
Dim ppt as Object = Nothing If String.IsNullOrEmpty(Name) Then ppt = GetInstance(Handle).ActiveDocument If ppt Is Nothing ' We need to create a deafult workbook 'doc = NewDocument(Handle) End If Return ppt Else Return GetInstance(Handle).Documents(Name) End If
End Function

stage.name: Create PowerPoint Instance
stage.narrative: Creates an Instance to open the PowerPoint file.

condition.narrative: MS PowerPoint Application needs to be installed in the system.
Creates an Instance to open the PowerPoint file.

stage.name: Note1
stage.narrative:
Clean Up Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some finalisation (or "cleanup") tasks as your business object is closed down.
The cleanup action will be called automatically immediately after closing your business object at the end of a business process.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than before the disposal of the business object.

stage.name: Note2
stage.narrative:
Initialise Page
This is an optional page where you might choose to perform some initialisation tasks after your business object is loaded.
The initialise action will be called automatically immediately after loading your business object.
You will not be able to call this action from a business process, nor will it be called at any other time than after the creation of the object.

stage.name: Create Instance
stage.code:
Dim powerPoint as Object = CreateObject("PowerPoint.Application")
' Create a GUID with which we can kill the instance later ' if we have to play hardball to get rid of it. powerPoint.Caption = System.Guid.NewGuid().ToString().ToUpper()
handle = GetHandle(powerPoint)

stage.name: Check Handle
stage.code: ' Just ensure that the handle references a valid instance handleMissing = (GetInstance(handle) is Nothing)

exception.detail: "Handle: " & [Handle] & " does not correspond to a PowerPoint Instance"

stage.name: Open Presentation
stage.narrative: Opens a PowerPoint file.

condition.narrative: An Instance needs to be created and the file to be opened must be an existing PowerPoint file.
Opens the given file.

stage.name: Open Document
stage.code:
Try GetInstance(handle).Presentations.Open(fileName) success=True
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
End Try

stage.name: Create Presentation
stage.narrative: Creates a new presentation with a slide of the mentioned layout. If the layout is not mentioned then it will take the default layout style.

condition.narrative: An Instance needs to be created.
Creates a new presentation with a slide

input.name: Layout
input.narrative: Numbers starting from 1 to 36, each number has different layout style (Opt) (Default layout will be Title Slide's Layout)

stage.name: Create Presentation
stage.code:
Dim presentation,slide as Object Dim layoutGiven as Integer
Try
presentation=GetInstance(handle).Presentations.Add() layoutGiven=layout documentName = presentation.Name slide = presentation.Slides.Add(1,layoutGiven) success=True
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
presentation=Nothing slide=Nothing layout=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Show
stage.narrative: Shows a opened or hid file (Not for MS office)

condition.narrative: The file needs to be opened and should be running at the backend
Shows the file

stage.name: ShowInstance
stage.code: GetInstance(handle).Visible = True

stage.name: Hide
stage.narrative: Hides the Powerpoint file (Not for MS office)

condition.narrative: The file need to be opened.
Hides the Opened file

stage.name: Hide Instance
stage.code: GetInstance(handle).Visible = False

stage.name: Exit PowerPoint
stage.narrative: Closes the entire powerpoint application. NOTE: Unsaved files won't be saved so make sure that there are no unsaved presentations before using this action.

condition.narrative: Powerpoint Application needs to be active.
Closes the entire application and all the presentations that are running.

stage.name: Exit
stage.code:
Dim app As Object = GetInstance(handle) app.Quit()
Me.HandleMap.Remove(handle) Me.InstanceMap.Remove(app)

stage.name: Close
stage.narrative: Closes a presentation with this action

condition.narrative: An Active Presentation.
Closes the Application without saving

stage.name: Close
stage.code: GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Close

stage.name: Add Slide
stage.narrative:
Adds a slide to the presentation with the existing slide's layout and gives the slide number as output.
If the layout is given it adds the slide with the given layout.

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
Adds a slide to the presentation at the end

input.name: Layout
input.narrative: Layout of the slide ranging from 1 to 36 (Opt) (Default Value - Will take the previous slide's layout)

output.name: Slide Number
output.narrative: The slide number where the slide got added

stage.name: Edit Area
stage.narrative: Edits an area of a slide. Each area's number is represented as Content area number (Eg: Content area number of title area is 1 and the below content will be 2 and so on)

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation.
Adds the content to the given slide's area.

input.name: Font
input.narrative: Font of the header (Opt) (Default Value - Arial) (If an Unsupported font style is given then the default font of the application is taken)

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: Slide number where the header going to be inserted (Req)

input.name: Red
input.narrative: Red in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Green
input.narrative: Green in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Blue
input.narrative: Blue in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Content Area Number
input.narrative: The area to be filled with content (Req)

input.name: Override
input.narrative: Overrides the existing text if set to True else the text gets appended to the existing one (Opt) (Default Value - False)

stage.name: Edit Header
stage.narrative: Edits the header area alone

stage.name: Edit Area
stage.code:
Dim application,activeSlide as Object Dim key,redCol,greenCol,blueCol,shapeNumber as Integer
redCol=Int(red) greenCol=Int(green) blueCol=Int(blue) success=True
Try
application= GetInstance(handle) slideCount=application.ActivePresentation.Slides.Count key = Int(slideNumber) shapeNumber=Int(shape)
activeSlide = application.ActivePresentation.Slides(key) areaCount=activeSlide.Shapes.Count
If override Then
With activeSlide.Shapes.Item(shapeNumber).TextFrame.TextRange .Text = text .Font.Name = font .Font.Size = fontSize .Font.Color.RGB = RGB(redCol, greenCol, blueCol) End With
Else
With activeSlide.Shapes.Item(shapeNumber).TextFrame.TextRange.InsertAfter(text) .Font.Name = font .Font.Size = fontSize .Font.Color.RGB = RGB(redCol, greenCol, blueCol) End With
End If
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
application=Nothing key=Nothing activeSlide=Nothing redCol=Nothing greenCol=Nothing blueCol=Nothing shapeNumber=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Paste as Special
stage.narrative: Paste's the copied data as special in the specified slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation and some data must be on clipboard
The copied data is pasted in the given slide and will return the total Content area number after pasting

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: To paste the copied data in the specified slide (Req)

output.name: Content Area Count
output.narrative: Returns the total Content area available in that slide after pasting

stage.name: Create New Slide
stage.code:
Dim slides, custLayout as Object Dim count, gnLayout as Integer
success = True
Try slides= GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides count=Slides.Count
If count = 0 Then Slides.Add(1,1)
Else If layout>0 Then gnLayout=Int(layout) slideNumber=Int(count+1) Slides.Add(slideNumber,gnLayout)
Else CustLayout=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides(count).CustomLayout slideNumber=Int(count+1) Slides.AddSlide(slideNumber,custLayout)
End If
Catch e As Exception success = False message = e.Message
Finally
slides=Nothing custLayout=Nothing count=Nothing gnLayout=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Resize
stage.narrative: Resize an image in the slide

condition.narrative: An image to be resized in the slide
Image will be resized

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: Slide Number to resize an image (Req)

input.name: ShapeCount
input.narrative: The image to resize if more than 1 found (Req)

input.name: Left
input.narrative: X axis position of the image (Req)

input.name: Top
input.narrative: Y axis position of the image (Req)

stage.name: Resize
stage.code:
Dim Active as Object Active=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides(Int(slideNo)) Active.Shapes(shapeCount).Select
With GetInstance(handle).ActiveWindow.Selection.ShapeRange .Height = height .Width = width .Left = left .Top = top End With

stage.name: Save Presentation as
stage.narrative: Saves the file with the given file name to the specified directory.

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
The Powerpoint file or Presentation is saved to the specified location with the given filename.

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: Name of the file to be saved (Req)

input.name: Directory Name
input.narrative: Directory name, where the file to be saved (Req) (Format:- C:\Folder\Sub Folder\)

stage.name: Save as
stage.code:
Dim application as Object Dim fileExists as Boolean
success=True message="" Try
application= GetInstance(handle) fileExists = File.Exists(fileName)
If fileExists Then
message = "File Name: File Already Exists" success=False
Else application.ActivePresentation.SaveAs(fileName)
End If
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
application=Nothing fileExists=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Select Slide
stage.narrative: Selects a slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
Selects the mentioned slide

stage.name: Focus
stage.code:
Dim activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try
key=Int(SlideNumber) activeSlide=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=activeSlide.Count ActiveSlide(key).Select
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
activeSlide=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Run Macros
stage.narrative: Runs a macro in powerpoint

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation with a valid macro and *.pptm as extension.
The macro will run and will be executed

input.name: Macro Name
input.narrative: Name of the macro to be run (Req) (Format: PresentationName.pptm!MacroName, Eg: Presentation1.pptm!Macro1)

stage.name: Execute Macro
stage.code:
success=True
Try GetInstance(handle).Run(macroName)
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
End Try

stage.name: Save Presentation
stage.narrative: Saves the file with the existing name or the name provided by the application if the file is new.

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
Saves the file.

stage.name: Save
stage.code:
Dim presentation as Object = GetInstance(handle)
presentation.ActivePresentation.Save

stage.name: Get Total Slide Count
stage.narrative: Returns the total number of slides in the presentation

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
Returns the total number of slides in the presentation

output.name: Slide Count
output.narrative: Returns the total number of slides

stage.name: Get Total Slide
stage.code: slideCount=Int(GetInstance(Handle).ActivePresentation.Slides.Count)

stage.name: Insert Slide
stage.narrative: Inserts a slide to the presentation with the given layout

condition.narrative: Needs an active Presentation
Inserts a slide to the presentation

input.name: Layout
input.narrative: Layout of the slide ranging from 1 to 36 (Req)

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: Slide number to insert a new slide (Req)

stage.name: Insert New Slide
stage.code:
Dim slides as Object Dim gnSlideNumber,gnLayout as Integer
success=True
Try
slides=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=Slides.Count gnSlideNumber=Int(slideNumber) gnLayout=Int(layout) Slides.Add(gnSlideNumber, gnLayout) slideCount=Slides.Count
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally slides=Nothing gnSlideNumber=Nothing gnLayout=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Run Slideshow
stage.narrative: Opens the Presentation in the slideshow

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation with at least one slide present in it.
Will run the presentation in the slide show with presentation tab

stage.name: Run Slideshow
stage.code:
With GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.SlideShowSettings
.Run.View.AcceleratorsEnabled = False
End With

stage.name: Paste Slide
stage.narrative: Pastes an entire slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
The copied slide is pasted in the given slide

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: To paste the copied data in the specified slide (Req)

stage.name: Copy Slide
stage.narrative: Copies a slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation at least with a slide
Copies the mentioned slide

stage.name: Copy Slide
stage.code:
Dim activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try GetInstance(handle).Activate() GetInstance(handle) key=Int(SlideNumber) activeSlide=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=activeSlide.Count ActiveSlide(key).Copy
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
activeSlide=Nothing key=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Delete Slide
stage.narrative: Deletes a slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation at least with a slide
Deletes the mentioned slide

stage.name: Duplicate Slide
stage.narrative: Duplicates a slide

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation at least with a slide
Duplicates the mentioned slide

stage.name: Save & Close or Close Presentation
stage.narrative: Save and Close or just Close a Presentation with this action

condition.narrative: An unsaved presentation that is active.
Saves and Closes or just closes the Presentation.

input.name: Is Save Needed
input.narrative: Is save required before closing the presentation (Opt) (Default value - True)

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation
Adds the header text to the given slide's area.

input.name: Font
input.narrative: Font of the header (Opt) (Default Value - Arial) (If an Unsupported font style is given then the default font of the application is taken)

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: Slide number where the header going to be inserted (Req)

input.name: Red
input.narrative: Red in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Green
input.narrative: Green in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Blue
input.narrative: Blue in RGB combination for font (Opt) (Default Value - 0) (Valid range is between 0 - 255)

input.name: Override
input.narrative: Overrides the existing text if set to True else the text gets appended to the existing one (Opt) (Default Value - False)

stage.name: Is File Open
stage.code:
Dim stream as Object=""
isOpen = false
try
stream = new FileStream(fileName, FileMode.Open)
catch
isOpen = true
finally
if isOpen = false stream.Close() End if
end try

exception.detail: "File Name: Presentation is already in open"

stage.name: Slide Checker
stage.narrative: Checks whether the slide count is greater than 0

exception.detail: "Slide Number: Valid Range for Slide is 1"
"Slide Number: Valid Range for Slide is 1 to "&[Slide Count]
"File Name: Should not contain any of the characters <>/?\|:*"&[Quotes]

stage.name: Paste in Slide
stage.narrative: Pastes the copied text inside the specified content area of the given slide.

condition.narrative: Needs an Active Presentation and some text must be on the clipboard
The copied text is pasted in the specified content area of the given slide.

input.name: Slide Number
input.narrative: To paste the copied text in the specified slide (Req)

input.name: Content Area Number
input.narrative: The content area number where the copied text to be pasted (Req)

stage.name: Check for Valid File Name
stage.code:
Const invalidChar As String = "\/:*?<>|[]""" Dim charCount As Long
validFileName = True
For charCount = 1 To Len(invalidChar) If InStr(fileName, Mid$(invalidChar, charCount, 1)) > 0 Then validFileName = False Exit For End If Next

stage.name: Default Paste
stage.code:
Dim application,activeSlide as Object Dim key, areaNumber as Integer success=True
Try GetInstance(handle).Activate() key =Int(slideNumber) areaNumber=Int(contentAreaNumber) application=GetInstance(handle) slideCount=application.ActivePresentation.Slides.Count activeSlide = application.ActivePresentation.Slides(key)
With activeSlide .Shapes(areaNumber).TextFrame.TextRange.Paste
End With
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
application=Nothing activeSlide=Nothing key=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Edit Header
stage.code:
Dim application,activeSlide as Object Dim key,redCol,greenCol,blueCol as Integer
redCol=Int(red) greenCol=Int(green) blueCol=Int(blue) success=True
Try
application= GetInstance(handle) slideCount=application.ActivePresentation.Slides.Count key = Int(slideNumber) activeSlide = application.ActivePresentation.Slides(key)
If override Then With activeSlide.Shapes.Item(1) .Left=30 End With With activeSlide.Shapes.Item(1).TextFrame.TextRange .Text = text .Font.Name = font .Font.Size = fontSize .Font.Color.RGB = RGB(redCol, greenCol, blueCol) End With
Else
With activeSlide.Shapes.Item(1).TextFrame.TextRange.InsertAfter(text) .Font.Name = font .Font.Size = fontSize .Font.Color.RGB = RGB(redCol, greenCol, blueCol) End With
End If
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
application=Nothing key=Nothing activeSlide=Nothing redCol=Nothing greenCol=Nothing blueCol=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Special paste
stage.code:
Dim application,activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try key=Int(slideNumber) application=GetInstance(handle) slideCount=application.ActivePresentation.Slides.Count activeSlide = application.ActivePresentation.Slides(key) activeSlide.Select activeSlide.Shapes.PasteSpecial(Int(pasteOption)) shapeCount=ActiveSlide.Shapes.Count
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
application=Nothing activeSlide=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Delete Slide
stage.code:
Dim activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try GetInstance(handle).Activate() key=Int(SlideNumber) activeSlide=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=activeSlide.Count ActiveSlide(key).Delete
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
activeSlide=Nothing key=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Duplicate Slide
stage.code:
Dim activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try GetInstance(handle).Activate() key=Int(SlideNumber) activeSlide=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=activeSlide.Count ActiveSlide(key).Duplicate
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
activeSlide=Nothing key=Nothing
End Try

stage.name: Paste Slide
stage.code:
Dim activeSlide as Object Dim key as Integer success=True
Try
GetInstance(handle).Activate() key=Int(SlideNumber) activeSlide=GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation.Slides slideCount=activeSlide.Count ActiveSlide.Paste(key)
Catch e as Exception
success=False message=e.Message
Finally
activeSlide=Nothing key=Nothing
End Try

exception.detail: "Content Area Number: Valid Range is 1 to "&[Content Area Count]

stage.name: Activate Presentation
stage.narrative: While working on multiple presentations, this action activates the given presentation to work on it.

condition.narrative: Needs more than one presentation in open
Activates the corresponding presentation

input.name: Presentation Name
input.narrative: The name of the presentation to be activated. (Eg: Presentation1.pptx or Presentation1)

stage.name: Activate Presentation
stage.code:
Dim application as Object
application=GetInstance(handle)
With application.Presentations(fileName).Windows(1)
If Not .Active Then
.Activate
End If
End With

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "File Name: " & [File Name] & " does not exist or is not a file"

stage.name: Code1
stage.code: Dim oPPTFile as Object Dim max As Integer Dim min As Integer oPPTFile = GetInstance(handle).ActivePresentation 'Dim count as Integer = oPPTFile.slides.Count 'Dim x as Object = oPPTFile.Slides(slide_number).Select Dim oPPTShape as Object = oPPTFile.Slides(Convert.toInt32(slide_number)).Shapes.AddTable(data.Rows.Count + 1,data.Columns.Count, 30, 120, 900, 400) oPPTShape.Table.Rows(1).Height = 50 For i as Integer = 2 To oPPTShape.Table.Rows.Count oPPTShape.Table.Rows(i).Height = 30 Next min = 50 For i As Integer = 0 To data.Columns.Count - 1 max = 0 oPPTShape.Table.Cell(1, i + 1).Shape.TextFrame.TextRange.Text = data.Columns(i).ColumnName oPPTShape.Table.Cell(1, i + 1).Shape.TextFrame.TextRange.Font.Size = 11 If(max < Len(data.Columns(i).ColumnName)) Then max = Len(data.Columns(i).ColumnName) End If For j As Integer = 1 To data.Rows.Count oPPTShape.Table.Cell(j + 1, i + 1).Shape.TextFrame.TextRange.Text = data.Rows(j-1).Item(i) If(max < Len(data.Rows(j-1).Item(i))) Then max = Len(data.Rows(j-1).Item(i)) End If oPPTShape.Table.Cell(j + 1, i + 1).Shape.TextFrame.TextRange.Font.Size = 11 Next If(max * 4.5 < min) Then oPPTShape.Table.Columns(i + 1).Width = min Else oPPTShape.Table.Columns(i + 1).Width = max * 4.5 End If Next
